issue.title: 0.930 still gives me "inheriting final" error with an enum.Flag subclass
issue.body:
**Bug Report**

#11579 seems to fix #11578 in the 0.930 release, but still there are edge cases.

**To Reproduce**

Here is a minimal reproduction example.

```python
import enum


class StringSetFlag(enum.Flag):

    def __eq__(self, other):
        return self.value == other

    def __hash__(self):
        return hash(self.value)

    def __or__(self, other):
        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
            other = other.value
        if not isinstance(other, (set, frozenset)):
            other = set((other,))
        return set((self.value,)) | other

    __ror__ = __or__  # this line makes the error


class MyFlags(StringSetFlag):
    X = "x"
    Y = "y"
```

**Expected Behavior**

It should be accepted in type check.

**Actual Behavior**

```
test-enum.py:22: error: Cannot inherit from final class "StringSetFlag"
Found 1 error in 1 file (checked 1 source file)
```

**Your Environment**

- Mypy version used: 0.930
- Mypy command-line flags: `python -m mypy test-enum.py`
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files):
```
[mypy]
ignore_missing_imports = true
mypy_path = stubs,src
namespace_packages = true
explicit_package_bases = true
```
- Python version used: 3.9.7
- Operating system and version: Ubuntu 20.04 (amd64)

body: @flaeppe are you interested in working on this? ðŸ™‚

I could take a swing at it if I find some time, though I'm not too familiar with mypy code so I'm not sure what'll come out of it. 

If someone else feels like working on it, please go ahead

issue.title: Bump versions and move to GitHub actions

repository.name: django-enumfield
repository.description: Custom Django field for using enumerations of named constants

issue.body:
* Remove testing with Django<2.2 and Python<3.7

  Newer versions of mypy also (incorrectly) don't accept overriding enum
  attributes when subclassing. Mitigated by temporarily removing
  attributes from Enum base class.
  
  Mypy ticket can be found here: https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/12132

* Move to GitHub actions

---

Based on https://github.com/5monkeys/django-enumfield/pull/66#issuecomment-1003998396

I also tried including `Django==3.2` but it failed, felt more reasonable to bump that in a separate PR.

issue.title: Release 0.940 planning

labels.name: meta
labels.description: Issues tracking a broad area of work

issue.body:
I'm planning to make a 0.940 release in February (tentative timeline). If things go according to plan, I'd cut the release branch in the first half of February.

Here are some things that I'd like to have in the release:
- #12010
- #11847
- #9636

We also need at least one typeshed sync.

Any help with the above issues would be greatly appreciated!

Please post here any issues you'd like to see fixed in the release, or PRs you'd like to have merged. After cutting the release branch, only high-priority fixes can be cherry-picked.

issue.title: Support overriding dunder attributes in Enum subclass
issue.body:
### Description

Allows any dunder(`__name__`) attributes except `__members__` (due to it being read-only) to be overridden in enum subclasses.

Fixes #12132 

## Test Plan

Added tests to the `check-enum` suite

## Extra notes

I'm quite new to mypy's code. So please help out with stuff I might've missed or so. I'm also not sure if I've placed the `__members__` fail correctly or if it's better placed in the analyser. 

I also tried to fix sunder (`_name_`) attributes raising `AttributeError`s, but my changes needs a bit more polishing, so I left it for a later PR. Invalids there will raise during runtime anyways.

issue.title: Update Test Dependencies versions

milestone.title: v20.0a0
milestone.description: Alpha 0 for the next major release.

repository.name: python-telegram-bot
repository.description: We have made you a wrapper you can't refuse

issue.body:
Updates to our test suite:
black 22.3.0: out of beta
pytest 7.1.2: major release
mypy 0.950: fixes and improvements
pyupgrade 2.31.0: drops py 3.6 support + bug fixes (can't find a changelog)
pylint [2.13.7](https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/releases/tag/v2.13.7): major release

Note about mypy:
- There are many ignores in Enums because of https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/12132 . Edit: Resolved in mypy [0.942](https://mypy-lang.blogspot.com/2022/03/mypy-0942-released.html).

Note about `pytest.approx`:
- datetimes are not supported by approx (https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/8395), so we should not use them.

TODO:
~~Update `furo` dependency.[ Lots of new features added](https://github.com/pradyunsg/furo/blob/main/docs/changelog.md). Including edit on github button.~~ 
Completed in #2969 
- [x] Add `--enable=useless-suppression` to pylint args. This will warn about [unused pylint ignore comments](https://docs.pylint.org/en/v2.12.2/user_guide/message-control.html?highlight=useless-suppressin#detecting-useless-disables)
- [x] Update pylint to new version [2.13.7](https://github.com/PyCQA/pylint/releases/tag/v2.13.7)
- [x] Update mypy again to resolve above issue
- [x] In c3eda6f / #2937 we added the hard pinned click dependency for black in requirements-dev.txt and .pre-commit-config.yaml, revert this here when upgrading black to => 22.3.0
- [x] update `pytest-asyncio` and use the new functionality of auto-detecting `async` tests to remove the `@pytest.mark.asyncio`. Since some of the monkeypatched tests block with that, they'll have to be adjusted - see [@a3f15f9](https://github.com/python-telegram-bot/python-telegram-bot/pull/2731/commits/a3f15f9921d7c2bc4b4681b6ce149eb04a76a817)
- [x] update sphinx to [`4.5.0`](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/changes.html#release-4-5-0-released-mar-28-2022)
- [x] migrate to pre-commit.ci for pre-commit tests
- [x] maybe add `isort` to the pre-commit setup
